No, not within QDK. 

If you are an ASL hand coder you can break your code up into 'libraries', so that you only need have the specific bunch of rooms/objects or whatever you are working on to scroll through in your code editor, but QDK doesn't help you here.

Best suggestion I can have is similar to circleMUD and such. Think of areas in your game as zones. The city is zone one, so all rooms in the city would start with a 1. You could be very detailed or very vague in their names, it would help organize things though. Here's some examples...

1001-DrunkDwarfTavern-BarRoom (Pretty detailed)
1028-Goresh'sArmory (Detailed a bit)
1015-Streets (A bit of info about it)
1004 (Simple name reflecting that it is room 4 in the city zone)

It makes sense, trust me.
